title: Qualcomm sales and forecast come up light as smartphone chip sales fall 25%
description: Qualcomm is exposed to the slumping smartphone industry because it makes the processors at the heart of most high-end Android devices.

title: AMD forecast, U.S. credit downgrade drags down chip stocks
description: Chip stocks dipped Wednesday, after AMD reported a gloomy forecast that may have spooked investors across the sector.

title: Elon Musk tweets and Twitter bots drove up price of FTX-listed altcoins, research finds
description: Sam Bankman-Fried and his crypto hedge fund Alameda Research benefitted from the fake bot activity on Twitter, which drove up the prices of several altcoins.

title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon calls Fitch Ratings U.S. downgrade 'ridiculous,' but says 'doesn't really matter'
description: Still, it is "ridiculous" that other countries are rated higher than the U.S. when they depend on the stability created by the U.S., Dimon added.

title: Hollywood producers seek sit-down with striking writers, the first sign of stalemate break
description: It's the first sign of movement in a stalemate between the sides, which began in early May when talks broke down.

title: Foreign buyers are bailing on the U.S. housing market. Here's why
description: High mortgage rates, soaring home prices, a meager supply of homes for sale and a strong dollar make homes less financially attractive for international buyers.

title: Ferrari raises guidance after profit jumps as more customers personalize their sports cars
description: Ferrari has greatly extended its options lists, offering its customers a huge range of choices in paint finishes, interior materials and other details.

title: Shares of Chinese Tesla rival Xpeng fall 5% after head of autonomous driving resigns
description: Xinzhou Wu, vice president of autonomous driving at Xpeng, has tendered his resignation "for personal and family reasons," the company said in a statement.

title: iPhone maker Foxconn to invest $600 million into phone and chip project in India
description: Foxconn is looking to diversify its business beyond China at a time when India is trying to bring high-tech manufacturing to its shores.

title: 'Unprecedented heat': Iran begins two-day nationwide shutdown amid soaring temperatures
description: The two-day shutdown comes at a time of record-breaking extreme heat across the globe, with July poised to be the hottest month in history.

title: China floats two-hour daily limit of smartphone screen time for kids
description: The draft rules laid out by the increasingly powerful Cyberspace Administration of China are a broader push to prevent addiction among under 18s to apps.

title: U.S. debt downgrade sinks global markets — but economists are not concerned
description: Global stock markets tumbled on Wednesday after ratings agency Fitch downgraded the United States' long-term credit rating, but top economists say there is nothing to worry about.

title: China's capital Beijing battered by heaviest rainfall in 140 years
description: China's capital Beijing is pummeled by its heaviest rains since 140 years ago, leaving at least 20 dead.

title: AMD considers making a specific A.I. chip for China to comply with export controls
description: Nvidia and Intel have already created modified versions of their AI chips to ship to China to comply with export restrictions.

title: Singapore's prime minister pledges 'zero tolerance' after recent wave of political scandals
description: A wave of political scandals have rocked Singapore in recent weeks, tarnishing the pristine image that underpins its standing as a global financial center.

title: HSBC CEO on Farage-Coutts spat: 'We do not exit clients based on their lawful personal views'
description: HSBC CEO Noel Quinn said Tuesday that the lender would not "exit a client based on their lawful personal views."

title: U.S. House committee flags MSCI, BlackRock for China investments
description: U.S. investments in about 50 blacklisted Chinese companies is under scrutiny from the House of Representatives Select Committee on the Chinese Communist Party.

title: Ukraine has tested its allies' patience with its military strategy and demands
description: Most recently, tensions have emerged over Ukraine's military strategy and demands on NATO.

title: 'Long way to go': Bank of Japan douses hopes that policy tweak marks the end of easy policy
description: Deputy Governor Shinichi Ichida said there is "still a long way to go" before BOJ would even consider raising short-term interest rates to 0%.

title: Britain faces a mortgage crisis with renters and homeowners in the crossfire. Here's how to protect your money
description: Mortgage rates are soaring in Britain. Homeowners, would-be owners and renters are all feeling the impact. Experts weigh in on what's next.

title: Bank of England's next move divides economists as data paints a mixed picture
description: Market expectations are split over the Bank of England's next monetary policy move on Wednesday, as policymakers near a tipping point in their fight against inflation.

title: CNBC's top 200 global fintech companies: The complete list
description: From China's Ant Group to Sweden's Klarna, here is the complete list of the world's top 200 fintech companies.

title: From banking giants to lending up-and-comers — here are the world's top 200 fintech companies
description: From across the globe, spanning a diverse range of applications in finance — these are the world's top fintech companies.

title: Saudi Arabia and Turkey are emerging as the new peace brokers of the Russia-Ukraine war
description: Turkey and Saudi Arabia are well-positioned as brokers, given their positive relationships with Russia while at the same time being longtime allies of the West.

title: India's rice export ban to hurt millions globally. These countries will be the worst hit
description: India's rice export ban is expected to hit millions, with Asian and African consumers set to bear the biggest brunt.

title: International group working to identify Russian forces that carried out grisly war crimes on Kherson prisoners
description: According to new evidence gathered by the investigation, at least 36 victims described the use of electrocution during interrogations of Kherson prisoners.

title: China turns to rural tourism and smart appliances to boost consumption
description: Instead of handing out cash, China is trying to make sure consumers and businesses spend where authorities want it to matter economically.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Market bears refuse to concede
description: Despite the S&P 500’s five-month rally, some market bears refuse to concede. And numbers yesterday might back them up.
